entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 12:51AM AKST until December 21 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 9:26PM AKST until December 22 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility occurring. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch are expected. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 1:50PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and gusty winds tonight... Snow will move into the area this evening with 2 to 4 inches of additional accumulation. West to northwest winds will increase to 5 to 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph. Gusty winds may blow snow off trees, or blow trees laden with snow, on to power lines creating power outages.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 1:54AM PST until December 22 at 4:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Multiple Winter Storms to Impact Holiday Mountain Travel through the Weekend... .A series of winter storms will bring multiple rounds of mountain snow and gusty winds Tuesday through Sunday. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 3:04PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER WILL RESULT IN MAJOR TRAVEL DISRUPTIONS MID WEEK THROUGH THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada this week. There will be few meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin late Tuesday so plan ahead.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Surprise Valley California

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches possible with localized amounts up to 24 inches over higher remote terrain. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph over exposed terrain.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 2:52PM PST until December 23 at 4:00PM PST by NWS

Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches in the mountains. 3 to 6 inches near Pinedale and Daniel, with locally higher amounts up to 9 inches near Hoback Junction. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Upper Green River Basin Foothills; Wind River Mountains West

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued December 21 at 3:02AM MST until December 24 at 6:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches possible. * WHERE...Star Valley. * WHEN...From 6 AM Thursday through 6 AM Friday.
